page.title: 03LIFE STYLES.
page.content:
. Glastry is a typical small community in the Ards. There are two churches: Glastry Presbyterian and manse, Glastry Methodist and manse. The choice of site was probably determined by its central location in the Peninsula. Around the churches has grown a small community of twelve families. There are two farms, an antiques business which opens only in the evenings and weekends, and another converted farm complex which now specializes in pottery and engraved glass. Glastry House was once the residence of the Savage family.
The situation right in the centre of the Peninsula was ideal for the Churches. The Education Authorities also recognized its potential when they were choosing the site for a new Secondary school in 1957.
